body_html:
I tried the following methods, none of them helped:

  1. tried to run the code using docker image tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-gpu, the behavior is almost the same. Slowed down after ~10k iteration
  2. tried to use 0.9.0, with pip package at
 https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow-0.9.0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl

This slows down even faster. More over, the GPU usage is only ~30% at beginning and ~10% after slowed down. However, the speed is ~0.160-0.250 sec/batch; while for the 0.10.0rc version, GPU usage is ~90% but the speed is only 0.330-0.360 sec/batch. I'll report this problem in another issue. Anyhow, the slowing down problem still exists.

I'll try to install tf from lastest source code and see if that helps or not. Will report later.

using nightly build didn't help.

However, the speed is ~0.160-0.250 sec/batch; while for the 0.10.0rc version, GPU usage is ~90% but the speed is only 0.330-0.360 sec/batch. I'll report this problem in another issue. body:
I tried the following methods, none of them helped:
1. tried to run the code using docker image tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-gpu, the behavior is almost the same. Slowed down after ~10k iteration
2. tried to use 0.9.0, with pip package at 

```
 https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow-0.9.0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl
```

This slows down even faster. More over, the GPU usage is only ~30% at beginning and ~10% after slowed down. However, the speed is ~0.160-0.250 sec/batch; while for the 0.10.0rc version, GPU usage is ~90% but the speed is only 0.330-0.360 sec/batch. I'll report this problem in another issue. Anyhow, the slowing down problem still exists.

I'll try to install tf from lastest source code and see if that helps or not. Will report later.

using nightly build didn't help.
